keyword: how many calories in one scrambled egg
title: How Many Calories in One Scrambled Egg?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in one scrambled egg, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in One Scrambled Egg?
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), scrambled with 1 tsp milk and 1/2 tsp butter; no added salt or other ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, milk type, cooking method, and seasonings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One scrambled egg provides ~91 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: No added butter or milk (plain scrambled)

faqs.q: How many calories in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal milk and butter.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a scrambled egg?
faqs.a: Roughly 6 g protein per scrambled egg.

faqs.q: Do scrambled eggs have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: About 7 g total fat, including 3.5 g saturated, mainly from the egg yolk and added butter.

faqs.q: How does scrambling affect calories compared to boiled?
faqs.a: Scrambled adds ~10-40 kcal from fats/milk; plain boiled is ~78 kcal.

faqs.q: Can I reduce calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Yes, skip butter/milk for ~51 kcal, or use non-fat milk and non-stick spray.
